meanings.definition: A man who herds and tends cattle, especially in the western US.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy rode his horse across the vast prairie.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy rounded up the cattle at sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy tried to lasso a cloud, thinking it was a stray calf.
meanings.sent4: She was a cowboy in the world of finance, always rounding up profits.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy's hat cast a long shadow as he rode into the sunset.

meanings.definition: A reckless or irresponsible person, especially a driver.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy behind the wheel sped through the red light.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy driver weaved in and out of traffic dangerously.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy driver thought stop signs were just suggestions.
meanings.sent4: She was a cowboy on the road, taking risks at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy driver's car was a wild stallion, hard to control.
